DENVER = Sonny Liston is
home relaxing probably wonder
ing when his opponent heavy
weight champion Cassius Clay
will be able to defend his crown.


1t was estimated that S25O,OOO
was lost when Clay was stricken
by hernia ailment which can
celled the fight last month.


Medical opinions agree that
Clay, %, will be able to fight
within six months following the
surgery.


Liston remains calm and says,

rights for Scr1pto employees in

TENDER, 1868.


A union spokesman said more
than 700 of the 900 employees at
the plant we're Negroes. He said
only six of the Negroes we're
classified as "skilled' workers.
The majority of Negro workers
he said, earned $l.25 an hour.

Forty-seven Arizona charities
and service institutions have re-
ceiped $4,000 this Christmas
from members of the Arizona
Wholesale Beer and Liquor As
socation.


The donation brings gifts from
this organization to SIS 900 since
the program was begun 10 years
ago whereby the wholesalers give
to charity what they ordinarily
would spend on gifts to their re-
tail customers, said w. A. Jen-
kins of Tucson. president of the
group.

ATLANTA = Local 574 of the
International Chemical Workers
Union went on strike against
Scripto, Inc. 1t charged that the
ball-point pen manufa cturer dis
eliminated against Negro en-
ployes.


Scripto's general manager, ].
E. Aderhold, said the company
was still in production.


The union won bargaining

home relaxing probably wonder
ing when his opponent heavy

1t was estimated that S25O,OOO

celled the fight last month.


Medical opinions agree that

within six months following the
surgery.

tail customers, said w. A. Jen-
